definition: to bawl/to wail/to cry
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
to cry/to weep

sentences.english: Weeping and wailing should follow, and beatings are borne without complaint.
sentences.chinese: 再跟着下來就是號哭，就算被鞭撻也不埋怨。

sentences.english: Here was a crying child, and there a noisy wife .
sentences.chinese: 這裏有一個號哭的孩子，那邊有一個叫喊的女人。

sentences.english: Woe weeps out her division, when she sings.
sentences.chinese: 當她歌唱時，悲哀號哭出她的聲部。

sentences.english: Don't just sit there boohooing like a baby.
sentences.chinese: 不要只坐在那裏像個小寶寶一樣號哭。

sentences.english: She always boohooed about her troubles.
sentences.chinese: 她老爲她的煩惱事號哭。

sentences.english: A good bawl usually makes her feel better.
sentences.chinese: 一場號哭通常會使她好過些。

sentences.english: The father, crying and wailing, begs his son to drink again.
sentences.chinese: 父親號哭起來，懇求兒子再喝。

sentences.english: The father, crying and wailing, begs his son to drink again. The patrons chant, Take another drink!
sentences.chinese: 父親號哭起來，懇求兒子再喝。
